title: Logical Reasoning Basics
why: This Logical Reasoning Basics exam assesses your ability to apply fundamental logical principles, including deductive reasoning and analogical thinking. It evaluates your understanding of syllogisms, your capacity to draw valid conclusions from given statements, and your skill in recognizing relationships between concepts. Taking this exam helps you gauge your aptitude for logical analysis, which is crucial for problem-solving and critical thinking in various contexts.

questions.question: All dogs are animals. Some animals are brown. Does it follow that some dogs are brown?
Complete the analogy: Bird : Fly :: Fish : __
True or False: If all roses are flowers, then some flowers are roses.
What does 'All men are mortal' mean?
Complete the analogy: Sun : Day :: Moon : __
All cats are mammals. Fluffy is a cat. What can you conclude?
True or False: If some birds can fly, then all birds can fly.
Complete the analogy: Pen : Write :: Knife : __
All apples are fruits. Some fruits are red. Does it follow that all apples are red?
What is the relationship in the analogy: Teacher : Student :: Doctor : __?
True or False: If all cars have wheels, then some vehicles have wheels.
All students study. John studies. Does it follow that John is a student?
Complete the analogy: Hot : Cold :: Light : __
All trees have leaves. Some leaves are green. Does it follow that some trees are green?
What does deductive reasoning involve?
